title: Takyeon
author: Takyeon
content: How do you restart your mining rig remotely if you are not at home or at the farm? I am talking about rigs that goes into deep frozen state where you will only need to press the power button for few seconds before working again.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: Takyeon on May 26, 2022, 09:20:56 AMHow do you restart your mining rig remotely if you are not at home or at the farm? I am talking about rigs that goes into deep frozen state where you will only need to press the power button for few seconds before working again. I use a smart wi-fi socket and in the BIOS of the motherboard I need to enable the AC power function. When voltage appears in the mains, your motherboard will start.You can use a smart wi-fi socket and electrical relays.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on May 26, 2022, 02:42:31 PMQuote from: Takyeon on May 26, 2022, 09:20:56 AMHow do you restart your mining rig remotely if you are not at home or at the farm? I am talking about rigs that goes into deep frozen state where you will only need to press the power button for few seconds before working again. I use a smart wi-fi socket and in the BIOS of the motherboard I need to enable the AC power function. When voltage appears in the mains, your motherboard will start.You can use a smart wi-fi socket and electrical relays.I was going to suggest this very same thing.  Basically, you just need a way to cut off power to the mining rig and then restart it (hence the smart power socket).  Then if you have your miner set with the above mentioned settings, it will automatically turn back on as soon as power is restored from the smart socket.  Then of course you have startup items set so that once your miner reboots, it opens the necessary software and begins mining on it's own.  It's a great solution to an issue that software won't be able to help with (because when your miner freezes, nothing is going to work).

comments.author: Wincob
comments.body: Option is available in hiveOS and you can do this miles away from home using your phone, you will be able to see if your rig is still running or not and with hiveOS reboot your PC will restart no matter what state of frozen it is.

comments.body: I use this to restart my rigs. comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: Wincob on June 01, 2022, 06:11:10 AMOption is available in hiveOS and you can do this miles away from home using your phone, you will be able to see if your rig is still running or not and with hiveOS reboot your PC will restart no matter what state of frozen it is. You can restart or turn off the mining farm if your Hive OS is working and the problem is only in the miner. If your mining farm is not connected to the network, then on ordinary motherboards you will not solve the problem.
